sub_title: Head of Content bij Coöperatie VGZ
summary:
Energetic and dedicated customer driven, future focused and sustainability minded Lead in Brand, Content and Campaigning with extensive experience in strategic and executional roles. Huge passion for building and growing brands, developing brand partnerships, creating engaging content and high impact campaigns. Surpassing user expectations across all touchpoints in the customer journeys, driving both ROE and NPS. Collaborative and emphatic people coach with distinctive Think and Do skills. Loves working in a test&learn, agile and data driven environment with a sense of urgency for Digital Transformation

Strategy | Full Funnel Campaigning | Content | Digital Transformation | Brand Management | Purpose | Customer Journey | Data | Agility

My values: growing together, honesty, loyalty, empathy, being bold and driving change, demonstrating passion and performance

awards.title: Marketing Talent of the Year - 2006
awards.description:
The Nationale Marketing Strijd (literally translated the National Marketing Battle) is the largest two-day marketing event for university students initiated by the Marketing Association Netherlands (MAN). The event is aimed at marketing students of Dutch top universities in the final phase of their studies. Every year, about 300 students apply. The companies that participate in this event, eventually select 160 students. During a couple of inhouse days (prior to the battle) and during the event itself, complex marketing cases needed to be worked out and presented.
For the finale we had to solve a marketing case for DSM, which is a global science based company active in health nutrition and materials. We had to look into the application of beer enzyme products and the relationship with suppliers. We won because of our level of out-of-the- box AND practical thinking in solving the case.

courses.name: Intermediar Trainingen: Effectief Beïnvloeden (Effectively influencing your stakeholders)

profile_positions.title: Sr. Expert Content & Communicatie - Team Merk&Campagne

profile_positions.description:
Leading a team of 6 marketing communication & content and campaigning experts. Elevating Schiphol's non aviation business (retail, F&B, parking and premium services) both online and on-the-spot.
Key Accountabilities:
- Purpose, Brand Strategy and Positioning, Marketing & Communication Strategy, Content Strategy
- Creating and executing high impact Propositions and Campaigns
- Media Strategy and Performance
- Digital Transformation
- Product Development and Collaborations
- Building communities
- The airport's Sustainability Hub
- Team Transformation

Key Project: leading the total rebranding of the Schiphol Shopping brand including purpose, positioning, strategy and visual identity. Turned the renewed retail positioning into impactful TTL campaigns, full funnel content plans and excellent execution at the point of purchase. Major deliverable is the launch of a completely new content driven website with e-commerce functionalities. Working with DAM, PAM and CMS applications.
profile_positions.title: Lead Brand, Content & Campaigning

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the development and implementation of the brand- and communication strategy and brand activation and media plans for both Parking as well as See Buy Fly.

Key project: due to the building of the new A-pier, the most lucrative and valued sheltered car park at Schiphol - P2- had to be demolished. It resulted in a comprehensive project involving a total turnaround of Parking's product portfolio and the creation of two important campaigns: Mind Your Plek to create awareness about the demolition followed by Find Your Plek that taught frequent flyers about the new product portfolio and helped change this target group's routine behaviour. My expertise, innovative mind set, creations and strategy helped to keep both market share as well as revenues stable.
profile_positions.title: Brand Manager Retail & Parking

profile_positions.description:
Schiphol Media is the exploiter of all advertising and branding possibilities in and outside the terminal building of Amsterdam Airport Schiphol. As the allround marketeer, I was responsible for all marketing and communication activities to attract new advertisers or upsell the exisiting. 
Next to this role, I joined Schiphol’s Social Media team for 2 days a week, including developing both the corporate and more commercials strategy, the creation of posts, social gifting and general webcare for the airport’s social accounts.
profile_positions.title: Marketeer Schiphol Media

profile_positions.description:
VNU Media is a leader in the recruitment advertising market in the Netherlands, with a strong portfolio of brands including NationaleVacaturebank.nl and  Intermediair.nl, which are supported by a number of print titles.

Marketing & Sales Analist in the Business Intelligence department:
-	Advising role to Board, publishers, sales- and marketing management within VNU
-	Initiating and developing analyses for market- and sales strategy and segmentation
-	Developing forecastings models using SPSS
-	Contributing to strategic planning (budget and LE)
-   Product performance analyses
profile_positions.title: Marketing Intelligence Analyst

profile_positions.description:
-	Collect, analyse and present research data
-	Programming of surveys
-	Working closely together with external market research companies
-	Conducted researches: job orientation and application behavior, employer branding, customer satisfactions, advertising awareness and polls
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description: The newly developed Communication Guidelines from ABN AMRO's Wholesale Clients department was released and implemented shortly before I started my internship at the bank. In the first 4 months of the internship my assignment was to investigate the awareness about and user friendliness & understanding of the new guidelines amongst all communication professionals at ABN AMRO offices around the globe. My task was also to collect examples of products that had already been made using the newly introduced guidelines, analyze them and give recommendations for better use of the branding guidelines. At the launch, all collegues at the different foreign offices were provided with a toolbox consisting of the new font, templates and visuals. My research showed that was a clear demand for enrichment of the toolbox with more ready-to-use visuals and more templates. The second part of my internship I spend on enriching the toolbox with various means and created a lot of new visuals and added new templates.
profile_positions.title: Intern Marketing Communications @ Wholesale Clients

profile_positions.description: Trident Transnational provides non-UK candidates aged 18 to 35 with work experience placements, internships and summer holiday jobs in the United Kingdom. I was responsible for doing interviews with candidates and matching them to relevant job opportunities. I arranged network activities, the so-called Get Togethers. My specific assignment at Trident was to optimise the candidates and jobs database and make it smarter and more user friendly.
profile_positions.title: Intern

volunteer_experiences.description: The La Luz foundation is a volunteer organisation that match young professionals to charities in order to donate knowledge. Being one of the professionals at La Luz, I did an assignment for the Amsterdam Food Bank. This charity supports households who can no longer afford daily groceries. 13,000 families in the Netherlands, of which 900 to 1000 in Amsterdam, depend on food banks in the provision of their daily food. Because of the fact that this number was growing rapidly, the Food Bank could hardly cope with the demand. And the warehouse they were housed in, was soon to be closed. Time to help! We were divided in six teams to provide concrete solutions for the organisation, knowing: structural relationships (with food suppliers),  inventory system, communication strategy, new housing, HR policy and a plan for the future. My team took care of making a plan for the realisation of structural relationships with food suppliers (preferably fresh food). We provided a list of local suppliers and already contacted a few big companies. Someone arranged a call center to contact the other 600. We got a big Dutch department store make Christmas packages for kids. We offered help in creating a system for giant corporates to ask their employers to donate their Christmas package to the Food Bank instead of keeping it for themselves.
